intro: Calophanoides pulgarensis, commonly known as the Brazilian starfish plant, is a unique member of the Araliaceae family. It is native to the rainforests of Brazil and is characterized by its striking, star-shaped leaves that resemble the arms of a starfish. The plant has a climbing habit, often using its aerial roots to attach to trees or other structures in its natural habitat. Its foliage is typically a deep green, with a glossy texture that helps it thrive in the humid, shaded conditions of the understory. Calophanoides pulgarensis is valued in horticulture for its ornamental appeal and ability to adapt to indoor environments with proper care.
